thread.title: Yamuna river flows above danger mark in Delhi - The Tribune
thread.title_full: Yamuna river flows above danger mark in Delhi - The Tribune

author: Tribune News Service
title: Yamuna river flows above danger mark in Delhi - The Tribune
text:
Yamuna river flows above danger mark in Delhi
The Yamuna river in Delhi flowed above the danger mark, reaching 205.35 metres at the Old Railway Bridge by 8 pm on Wednesday.
The water level remained above the warning mark of 204.50 metres for the second consecutive day, prompting heightened vigilance from authorities. The Central Water Commission (CWC) had issued a flood warning on Tuesday evening, predicting the river would cross the danger mark by Wednesday evening.
The surge is primarily attributed to substantial water releases from the Wazirabad and Hathnikund barrages, with 41,206 cusecs and 55,830 cusecs water discharged hourly, respectively.
Water from these barrages takes approximately 48 to 50 hours to reach Delhi, contributing to the rising levels. An official from the central flood room noted that even reduced upstream discharges are elevating the riverâ€™s levels, with forecasts suggesting further increases.
The CWC has directed officials to monitor the situation closely, warn people living close to river embankments, and prepare for potential evacuations, which are triggered when the water level reaches 206 metres.
The Old Railway Bridge remains a critical monitoring point for assessing flood risks. Authorities are on high alert, ready to evacuate communities if necessary, as Delhi braces for potential flooding.
